programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: Namila Benson meets artists Laurie Anderson, Aretha Brown and comedian Alok Vaid-Menon. Feel the power of music with Aaron Choulai and Tatana Village Choir and Rewire Musical Memories Choir for people living with dementia.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.sub-title: 1981: Doug Walters, Artie Johnson, Joanne Worley, Gordon Chater
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson interviews guests Doug Walters, Artie Johnson, Joanne Worley and Gordon Chater.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella prepares an array of suppertime favourites to suit all tastes, including lamb shanks with couscous, raw salmon with ginger and rice vinegar and a mouth-watering Creme Brulee.

programme.title: Portrait Artist Of The Year
programme.desc: In the Grand Final, three outstanding artists each have four hours to paint a portrait of adored comedy icon Denise Scott, each drawing on their unique approach to artmaking.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance 2023
programme.sub-title: Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Michelle Visage and Henning Wehn
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts The 2023 Royal Variety Performance from Londons Royal Albert Hall. Performers include Cher, McFly, Rick Astley, Zara Larsson, Paloma Faith, Hannah Waddingham, Lang Lang, Melanie C and Tom Allen.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Mark and Cherilyn Rice are an ambitious, well-resourced and capable couple building a four-storey modernist-style concrete, steel and glass home overlooking Mairangi Bay on Aucklands North Shore.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Fungi, Ned Kelly, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and Lin-Manuel Miranda
programme.desc: It takes all sorts, and Hard Quiz Kids is a big bag of liquorice! Vying for Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug are experts on fungi, Ned Kelly, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, and Lin-Manuel Miranda.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The team work a suspected suicide but the investigation raises more questions than it answers. Gabriel has an exciting new opportunity, both professionally and personally, and enlists Jacks help.

programme.title: rage Best of the Charts 2025
programme.desc: rage rounds up the best of the 2025 ARIA Singles Charts.

programme.title: rage In Memoriam 2025
programme.desc: rage pays tribute to the musicians and artists who passed away in 2025.

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: Mack interrupts Glenn and Daisys wedding when an uninvited guest collapses, poisoned by a seemingly random wedding program. But by halting the wedding, has she finally pushed Glenn too far? (Final)

programme.title: Call The Midwife: Christmas Special (2024)
programme.desc: Shelagh helps a family battle against appalling poverty and Rosalind comes face to face with an escaped convict, whilst romance is on the cards for Nancy.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Gwen is outraged when shes tricked into signing up for the lacrosse team, but its short-lived when she discovers Mary-Lou is out of sorts and needs her help.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Wrecked Rehearsal
programme.desc: When Esther is injured in the dress rehearsal of the Grade Five play, Maudie must figure out who caused the mishap before showtime.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Shaggy competes against singer Halsey in a poetry slam.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life Of Blossom Powerpuff
programme.desc: Blossom cant join her favourite school club.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer, Shaun and Flock are convinced that a monster is at loose on the farm and hide in the barn. But what exactly is it they are afraid of?

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Bill is struggling with her schoolwork due to spending too much time at the stables, but she and Darrell need Thunders help when someone at school has a serious accident.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Unhappy Camper
programme.desc: When Mr McGillicks phone goes missing at the Grade Five camp, Kyle is accused of hiding it as part of a prank.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Ruth and Connie have received a camera for their birthday, but when the mischievous second formers take a comedic photo of Matron, they have to work to retrieve the film!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: An angry, rampaging giant faces the gang in Ireland.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Racing to circumnavigate the globe in 80 days and earn 10 million clams, Passepartout the marmoset embarks on a crazy and thrilling adventure full of twists and surprises with his friend Phileas, a reckless and greedy frog.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Be officially amazed by some incredible parallel parking attempt plus shooting a bow and arrow with the feet.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by special guests Harry Hill and Lara Ricote for an entertaining look at the weeks events and to answer your #IsItOk questions.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: New kid Lee Delaine, desperately tries to fit in despite his father being the new humanities teacher.

programme.title: Miraculous World: Shanghai, Lady Dragon
programme.desc: On the occasion of a school break, Marinette heads to Shanghai to meet Adrien... and discover her own origins.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Ice Bear rides his custom vacuum into the city. But when a gang of techies steal the vacuum, Ice Bear goes on a rescue mission that takes him through the underground world of the city.

programme.title: Miraculous World: Tokyo, Stellar Force
programme.desc: Kagami drags Marinette to Tokyo to help the Stellars defeat a new supervillain. But Marinette soon realizes that her friend has another untold reason for this trip to Japan...

programme.title: Adventure Time
programme.desc: Jake is bitten by Lumpy Space Princess and starts to turn lumpy himself. Finn must find a cure that will save Jake, but he must go into another dimension to find it.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie test some classic scenes from the westerns and they start off with whats as common to spaghetti westerns as tomatoes are to spaghetti bolognaise.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phils in Scotland where Liz and Steve Mitchells four-bed has been on the market for a whopping three years. It doesnt take Phil long to see that Lizs love of colour is blinding buyers to this houses potential.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Carol proposes setting up a paediatric clinic for the ER. Mark reaches breaking point during a malpractice suit deposition. Benton struggles combining work and fatherhood, while Doug helps Anna examine a young athlete.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a young popstar is found dead at a rehab clinic, it initially looks like a tragic accident. But Neville is convinced theres more to her death than meets the eye.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: With showtime approaching, and an online audience waiting, the pressure is on. However, Richelle discovers she may be about to lose everything she has worked for...

programme.title: Miraculous World: New York, United Heroez
programme.desc: During a school field trip, Ladybug and Cat Noir meet the American superheroes, whom they have to save from an akumatised super-villain. They discover that Miraculous exist in the United States too.

programme.title: Badjelly
programme.desc: The path to Mudwiggles ferry leads the gang through the lair of The Unfungi, a grumpy old hermit who lives in a cave full of puzzles and traps.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Its a trucking fantastic episode as the mythbusters hit the road to test some Big Rig Myths. And they dont get any bigger than this.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Laura Staines and partner Gavin have been trying to sell their Whitley Bay three-bed home for more than a year. Phil makes it his mission to get them an offer but mould and mildew make for uneasy bedfellows.

programme.title: Melbourne Comedy Festival Allstars Supershow
programme.desc: Hannah Gadsby hosts a night of dazzling comedy with some of the brightest stars including Mel Buttle, Dilruk Jayasinha, David ODoherty, Urzila Carlson, Dave Hughes, Anne Edmonds, Dane Simpson and Dave Thornton. (Final)

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi set out to recover a mysterious artifact.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Despite protests from the Wise Old Elf, Ben accompanies Holly to her first day at Magic School.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a man cover his car in cleaning foam. Great BigHoo and Toodloo investigate the spray nozzle. Toodloo manages to get it to work but when Chickedy and Chick have a go, the spray nozzle squirts foam everywhere.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: O wants to sit in the front of Trolley, but Jodi gets carsick in the back. O realizes that he doesnt need the front seat like she does.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Beep! Beep! Jump aboard with Fizzy and Suds as they spend a day riding on a beautiful big bus. After that, lets see the bus have a bubble bath!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Get ready to sing along with Simon. Hes creating a brand-new rhyming song and, with help from his Wiggly friends, finds the perfect words to make a mighty tune!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The Browns are having their annual Summer Games. Will Paddington be good at any of them? Or will competitive dad Mr Brown ruin it for the children again?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children are taught how to play basketball by Daddy coach. They are soon good enough to take on a bigger team.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets attempt to train four young kids as Junior Junior Cadets - but their first lesson is a disaster!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosimas so excited to tell Big Lizard about her life on Earth that she doesnt realise he has something exciting to say to her.

programme.title: Play School: Interesting Insects
programme.desc: Emma and Matt can hardly hear you over the noisy cicadas! Matt makes a beehive painting and Kiya and Jemima have a noisy camping trip with a blowfly, cicada and mozzie!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: Spin finds his favourite socks under his bed, but theyre too small for him. The Mixmups mix up an adventure to find a way to grow them big again.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando experiment with Bings toy train in the playground. The train is good at going over bridges and at going down the slide. But when Bing slides it off the roof of the play house, the train crashes and breaks.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At school, Bluey and her friends turn a tree stump into a thrilling game of Helicopter. But as the pilot, Bluey has to learn to give up some control so they can all have fun.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In Australia, we find out whether he can make a funny fur monster in under a minute; and in South Africa discover how to make a colourful helicopter with recycled packaging and paper.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go!
programme.desc: When Carly discovers Yong Baos fear of creepy crawlies, she gently tries to change his mind about bugs.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad drops an essential gizmo in a hard-to-reach place. Big Lizard takes them on an underwater adventure to meet Ammon, the tentacled solution to their problem!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish is at Tobbys birthday party along with her friends Cori and Jeffy. Tobby has just opened his presents and Tish cant wait to play with them.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When the twins forget an important gadget needed for Ayanas school play, Jonathan must leave in the middle of the play to get it from the Dream Factory, leaving Drew to not only play his role in the show...

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Dashi snaps a picture of what appears to be a sea serpent, but the truth is stranger than fiction when it turns out to be an awesomely long Oarfish!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is trying his best to perfect his golf swing for an annual game of crazy golf with his pals, so he can finally bag an elusive hole-in-one and win the prize - a round of milkshakes.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When pickle-wielding Norman tries to protect Pontypandy from being attacked by Moon Men, his panic ends up causing a fire at Joes garage!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng make a fantastic feast of cauliflower cake and tabouleh salad. We see a family celebrating Eid al-Fitr with more festive food and fireworks, and Through The Windows, were invited to a birthday party!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the Peas reluctantly babysit a mischievous Baby Bananaraptor that proves to be more than a handful.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and her friends historical re-enactment society are being cave people today. Peppa and George join in helping to catch Grandpa Pig who is dressed as a woolly mammoth.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard wants to have a go with Dads new drone but first he has to prove that he can go a whole day without breaking something precious. Good luck Big Lizard!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce leads an adventure into a cave, but the cadets become trapped by the rising tide. Meanwhile, Frizzy goes in search of a volcano.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun goes extra Christmassy for the background of the Farmers Christmas card photo by secretly knitting festive jumpers to brighten it up.

programme.title: Zog And The Flying Doctors
programme.desc: Zog, Pearl and Gadabout are now a flying doctor trio, caring for all kinds of creatures. When bad weather forces them to land at the palace, Pearl is locked up by her uncle, the King, so Zog and Gadabout try to set her free.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nubs and the Jedi protect his favourite tree.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: After the disappearance of Mrs Fotheringill, Mrs Elf becomes the twins new teacher.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: Toodloo shows her balancing skills and Great BigHoo, while Chickedy and Chick run and roll out of the way.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel and his friends learn to play T-ball, they find out that Henrietta is a dance teacher and a T-ball coach

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Check this out Suds - volcanoes! How exciting! Fizzy and Suds find out about all about volcanoes and lava. Plus, we build our own volcano!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Tsehay has made some lemonade to share with her friends! There is some for Simon, but then there is no lemonade left for Anthony. What to do? Dorothy flies off in the Big Red Plane for help.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mrs Brown has bought an old camper van and decides to take the family on a camping holiday, but they get no further than the park and then get locked in!

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Its the fairy and witch family spring ritual of "Hunt The Bluebell.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Lauchie and Scarlett are making a homemade movie with their toys in the backyard, but Silver Paw is determined to be the superstar.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds visit an observatory to explore our planets! They see how planets orbit the Sun, what theyre made of, and theres a special trip to Mars!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach Summer Special
programme.desc: The cadets become stranded on a deserted beach and all seems lost. But Neville recalls another time they almost gave up, and we flashback to the first day of summer at Kangaroo Beach.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: The Town Hall clock has lost its Ding Dong. Myrtle relies on it to remind her to make important mayoral phone calls, Hattie to take her scones out of the oven so they dont burn, and Cynthia to start the train.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Siblings squabble about who gets to use the garden shed. Can the band settle the argument?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and her friends historical re-enactment society are being cave people today. Peppa and George join in helping to catch Grandpa Pig who is dressed as a woolly mammoth.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst searching for new discoveries a rockfall traps Dad, Cosima and Big Lizard in a cave. Just when all is lost Dad finally discovers a new species!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Rosa and Pola are planning a family movie afternoon, but Tish and Bobby cant decide on what to watch.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When CeCe visits the Dream Factory, Drew and Jonathan share the story of how they built the factory and began their dream.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Jelly Fish Bloom
programme.desc: When Shellington gets trapped in the middle of a massive Jellyfish bloom, its up to the Octonauts to rescue him!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When King Tiger suddenly cries out that his ruby has gone, the missing jewel turns the party into a mystery to be solved. Luckily Duggee has his Mystery Badge and some enthusiastic Squirrels to investigate!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! But when her brakes fall off, its up to Fireman Sam to rescue her before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.sub-title: Mission Stop the Stink / Mission Hooray for Holidays
programme.desc: Glitch builds a stink-making machine to wreak havoc on afternoon tea with Nana. / The spies are excited to be going on a family vacation.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners create magical teeny tiny gardens, perfect for small spaces.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today is the fire station practise day. Mummy Pig joins with the other mummies to practise fighting fires. The fire brigade demonstrate their practice using their motto: Ready, Steady, Go!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the Peas reluctantly babysit a mischievous Baby Bananaraptor that proves to be more than a handful.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko tries to train a naughty monkey... and hide this from An Yu.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is cleaning the clubhouse so the squirrels take refuge in the treehouse, but oh dear its getting a little bit cramped these days. Norrie has an idea - maybe they need to add an extension.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Nugget tries to make her friends Wishing Tree dreams come true but gets in a muddle.

programme.desc: Namila Benson meets artists Laurie Anderson, Aretha Brown and comedian Alok Vaid-Menon. Feel the power of music with Aaron Choulai and Tatana Village Choir and Rewire Musical Memories Choir for people living with dementia.

programme.desc: Shelagh helps a family battle against appalling poverty and Rosalind comes face to face with an escaped convict, whilst romance is on the cards for Nancy.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Why do we watch movies or TV shows weve seen before, even with so much new content at our fingertips? We explore the comfort watch and ask young people how it makes them feel.

programme.title: Tech Smart Agriculture
programme.desc: Australian farmers and governments spend a staggering amount of money to kill weeds. The fight relies heavily on chemical use. Queensland scientists are trying to change that. Plus their weapon of choice looks like a gun.

programme.title: Bee Cause
programme.desc: Millions of bees and hectares of habitat have been destroyed in Australia by unprecedented bushfires and drought. Australian honey may soon be imported and the vital pollinators will be in short supply for agriculture.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Dog Gone - The Hunt for Valerie
programme.desc: How the hunt for runaway sausage dog Valerie fired up the Kangaroo Island community and sparked headlines around the world.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 2006 - Shane Warne bowls Australia to series victory at the Adelaide Oval
programme.desc: Ashes history is littered with moments that have defined and intensified the rivalry between the two nations. Jim Maxwell and Corbin Middlemas look back to 2006 when Shane Warne bowled Australia to a series win in Adelaide.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Revisit some of the best Landline stories from 2025. The stone fruit that could help prevent dementia; and breeding mildew resistant heritage grape vines.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Ruby Cornish brings you the latest news and the top stories on Boxing Day, including updated news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: On the brink of death in India, Bharat Sundaresan turned to cricket, gathering millions of followers. But its now in Australia that the colourful commentator has found true acceptance.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Emma and Catherine celebrate the holidays with an all-star lineup of guests from 2025 including G Flip, Belinda Carlisle, Craig David, Ice Cube, Isla Fisher, Teddy Swims, Cynthia Erivo and Jennifer Lopez.

programme.title: Indonesia Down Under
programme.desc: Travel across Australia and discover the culture, food and special historical ties that Indonesia and Australia share. Delve into the connections as we highlight the rich Indonesian influences found in Australian communities.

programme.title: Regional Roundup
programme.desc: From fixing a fence to fleeing a flipped car, a freak tornado leaves a farmhand stunned in WA, front row seats at an opera performance under the outback stars, and speed dating rodeo style, can these lonely cowboys find love?

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you the latest news and the top stories on Boxing Day, including all the updated news, sport and weather you need to know.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you the latest news and the top stories on Boxing Day, including all the updated news, sport and weather you need to know.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you the latest news and the top stories on Boxing Day, including all the updated news, sport and weather you need to know.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.desc: Tech bros are racing to develop the first mass-produced humanoid. But despite investing billions of dollars, these robots require a great deal of human intervention. So, why has creating a humanoid proven so difficult?

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Part 2 of Back Roads epic trip along The Outback Way. Lisa Millar soaks up spectacular natural wonders and meets people making a big difference educating kids, before hitching a ride with a couple of "Warrior Princesses".

programme.title: Boxing Day Tsunami: Stories Of Survival
programme.desc: Stories of loss, resilience and the enduring human spirit as survivors of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami reflect on their survival, healing and the untold stories of a global catastrophe that still resonates two decades later.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Discover the voices of young Australians as they share powerful, lived experiences from life in regional communities. Stories from the 2025 Heywire project that celebrate resilience, creativity and the spirit of the regions.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Emma and Catherine celebrate the holidays with an all-star lineup of guests from 2025 including G Flip, Belinda Carlisle, Craig David, Ice Cube, Isla Fisher, Teddy Swims, Cynthia Erivo and Jennifer Lopez.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: A decade-long investigation has uncovered explosive new evidence suggesting that corrupt former NSW Crime Commission assistant director Mark Standens criminality was far more extensive than the public was led to believe.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Revisit some of the best Landline stories from 2025. The stone fruit that could help prevent dementia; and breeding mildew resistant heritage grape vines.

programme.title: Bee Cause
programme.desc: Rottnest Island is home to the worlds oldest queen bee breeding program. And bio-active honey from Western Australias unique Jarrah and other forests has been discovered by the world, sparking a liquid gold rush.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Boxing Day Tsunami: Stories Of Survival
programme.desc: Stories of loss, resilience and the enduring human spirit as survivors of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami reflect on their survival, healing and the untold stories of a global catastrophe that still resonates two decades later.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Back Roads goes in search of all creatures great and small on Kangaroo Island, off the South Australian coast. Guest presenter Paul West checks in to see how the island is faring after devastating Black Summer fires of 2020.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: Design is a reflection of history, heritage and identity. This episode explores cultural roots that influence modern design with a wood block printer in Bangalore, fashion designer in Jakarta and furniture designer in Mumbai.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Fiona Willan presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.desc: Fiona Willan presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. Melissa Mackay brings you the days news by reporters in more locations across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories.
